paragraphs.text: I think you just crashed through the illusion. Medium is not the landscape of which we have shaped but a corner. Currently, we’re effectively a community of ‘little princes’ awakening to the barrenness of an isolated satellite orbiting the larger disinterested corporate orb driven more with the functional propensity of LinkedIn to provide investor value, than be the artistic home we created in isolation of the rest of it.
paragraphs.name: ab4b

paragraphs.text: Good questions, and no clue. The author did end up blocking me. Maybe I should have blocked him to begin with. Regardless, the way that Medium handled this situation — in my opinion, at least — was not cool. Not cool at al. But, as I told Classy in a response on this thread, in regards to Medium, I have no more fucks to give.
paragraphs.name: e9e0

paragraphs.text: Medium ’s response is incomprehensible. The author Edwin’s public replys to your excessively POLITE responses are the definition of belligerence, though I wouldn’t call them harassment. I reserve the term harassment to describe persistent intimidation. The exchanges on neither side, and most certainly not yours, come close.
Um, ok? I wish you well, and I am a triggered bitch? Admittedly, now I am.
paragraphs.name: c9e9

paragraphs.text: Good questions, and no clue. The author did end up blocking me. Maybe I should have blocked him to begin with. Regardless, the way that Medium handled this situation — in my opinion, at least — was not cool. Not cool at all. But, as I told Classy in a response on this thread, in regards to Medium, I have no more fucks to give.
paragraphs.name: e9e0

paragraphs.text: Hey Renee. Thank you for your response. Yes, I agree; I am slowly coming to this understanding. I’d much rather be a person (or, more specifically, a writer) than a user statistic. I am not sure I like the latter. :(

c3feeb95e64c.title: This is not okay at all.

paragraphs.text: This is not okay at all. I’m sorry this happened, Michael. Knowing you as I do, I can’t imagine a more incongruous scenario.
paragraphs.name: e288

paragraphs.text: I couldn’t agree more Michael. I came here to (Medium) with the idea of it being the singular place for my work (writing & publishing); I loved what had been created by those I encountered and I loved the sense of a uniquely supportive environment for independent writing and publishing. It was a beautiful place made by a group of special individuals and it’s horrible watching it slowly going up in smoke.
paragraphs.name: e757

paragraphs.text: The worst I’ve done on here was call someone an ignorant coward after he said that an elderly Jewish historian who specialized in Hitler’s life who had his life threatened by Neo-Nazi supporters of Trump was betraying “his people in Israel” by not supporting Trump. That was the most insane comment I have ever heard in my entire life and I really tore…

paragraphs.text: “Harassment” I guess. (Though clearly the harassment runs both ways, unless Medium only picks and chooses what they deem “harassment.”) Alas, as for Medium, I have no more fucks to give. paragraphs.text: It’s here that Edwin crossed the Rubicon. Not only that, but his response displays the fact that he is out of ideas and out of his depth.

Great point, Meg. And yes, you’re right. Admittedly, my private response wasn’t as polite (I used “grow the fuck up,” verbatim, for instance) but as you’ve said, as compared to some public comments on other author pieces, it wasn’t nearly as wrong. I take responsibility for sending the author the message. I am only asking Medium to require the author…

paragraphs.text: I don’t know a one single case where somebody changed the way he/she thinks through online discussion. Slight adjustments might happened, but more or less our views are set pretty much in stone.
